goals.question: What is the trend of crime rate in Crimea over the years?
goals.visualization: Line chart of crime rate against year
goals.rationale: This visualization will help to identify if the crime rate is increasing or decreasing over the years.

goals.question: What is the distribution of crime rate across different regions in Crimea?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of crime rate against region
goals.rationale: This visualization will help to identify which regions have the highest and lowest crime rates.

goals.question: What is the relationship between crime rate and population density in Crimea?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of crime rate against population density
goals.rationale: This visualization will help to identify if there is any correlation between crime rate and population density.

goals.question: What is the most common type of crime in Crimea?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of crime type against frequency
goals.rationale: This visualization will help to identify which type of crime is most prevalent in Crimea.

goals.question: What is the distribution of crime rate across different times of the day?
goals.visualization: Line chart of crime rate against time of day
goals.rationale: This visualization will help to identify if there are any specific times of the day when crime rate is higher or lower.

code:
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['year'] = pd.to_datetime(data['year'], format='%Y', errors='coerce')
    data = data.dropna(subset=['year'])
    data = data.sort_values(by='year')
    sns.lineplot(x='year', y='crime_rate', data=data)
    plt.title('What is the trend of crime rate in Crimea over the years?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data = data.groupby('region').agg({'crime_rate': 'mean'}).reset_index()
    sns.barplot(x='region', y='crime_rate', data=data)
    plt.title('What is the distribution of crime rate across different regions in Crimea?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['crime_rate'] = data['total_crime'] / data['population_density']
    sns.scatterplot(x='population_density', y='crime_rate', data=data)
    plt.title('What is the relationship between crime rate and population density in Crimea?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data = data.dropna(subset=['type'])
    crime_count = data['type'].value_counts()
    plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
    sns.barplot(x=crime_count.index, y=crime_count.values, palette='Blues_d')
    plt.title('What is the most common type of crime in Crimea?', wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel('Type of Crime')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    return plt

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['time_of_day'] = pd.to_datetime(data['time_of_day'], format='%H:%M:%S', errors='coerce')
    data = data.sort_values(by='time_of_day')
    sns.lineplot(x='time_of_day', y='crime_rate', data=data)
    plt.title('What is the distribution of crime rate across different times of the day?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
